description.narrative: The goal of the 100 Resilient Cities (RC) program is for participant cities to produce and implement Resilience Strategies through an intensive planning development process. 100RC's core hypothesis is that cities, through the 100RC Resilience Strategy process, produce urban resilience plans and enact planning processes that build resilience. Plans and processes are then implemented and institutionalized by city governments through the 100RC intervention, potentially having a large positive impact on urban resilience. By incorporating resilience thinking in urban planning processes, member cities can achieve tangible results such as incorporating resilience measures into land -use regulation. The final expected outcome is the implementation of solutions for building resilience. Oxfam will be responsible for: 1) coordinate with Urban Institute on the development of data collection and reporting protocols to provide information in direct reference to 100RC's proposed long -term outcomes and the Rockefeller Foundation's research questions, including participation at an annual evaluators' meeting two of which will be held at Urban's Washington DC offices.; 2) plan for and execute data collection efforts in five planned cities within the 100 Resilient Cities cohorts—Can Tho, Chennai, Melaka, Semarang, and Wellington—including one intensive site visit (or remote interviews due to Covid -19 restrictions) in the summer of 2021. The proposing organization will provide all resources, tools, and logistical planning for their data obligations, including staff, travel, document translation, regional urban resilience scholarly input, etc., as needed.
